mHOBAx-s6.memHandModelNotes:
Hand Modeling****Select ecotone edge pixels IN ADDITION TO all other selections.  Notes: May forage at considerable distances (a mile or more) from the diurnal roost site (NatureServe 2000);KY-GAP used a 30m edge buffer for this species. AMUs are foraging habitat that is not considered roosting habitat also. Amy Silvano 20jun05

I assume Amy's model intends to select ALL map units within a 30m forest/open and shrubland/woodland edge, and not just the map units selected as primary and auxiliary for this species. This was the model approach I used to hand model this species. MJR 12 February 2008.

references.B74BAN01NAUS: Banfield, A.W.F. 1974. The mammals of Canada. University of Toronto Press, Toronto.

habitat_description: Lasiurus cinereus roosts at heights >3 m in the foliage trees, without any apparent preference for particular species or forest types, except that they tend to be less abundant in more closed forests. While the species often forages in open shrub or grasslands near the forest edge, it also forages in forest interior, often above the canopy. Therefore, forest and woodland areas were selected as primary map units, with grasslands and shrublands selected as auxiliary map units, with a 1 km buffer (Menzel et al., 2003; Sparks et al., 2005; Williams et al., 2006; Veilleux et al., 2009). The elevation limit of 3100 m was derived from Storz and Williams, 1996.
